model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Co-workers A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Co-workers A: I'm the boss!
Co-workers B: Yeah, we know. You don't have to remind us every five minutes.
Co-workers A: I just want everything to go smoothly and according to plan.
Co-workers B: I understand that, but it doesn't always have to be your way or the highway.
Co-workers A: Well, I just think that my way is usually the best way.
Co-workers B: And sometimes it is, but we all have different ideas and perspectives to bring to the table.
Co-workers A: Okay, I see your point. I'll try to be more open-minded in the future.
Co-workers B: That's all we can ask for. Remember that we're a team and we all have something valuable to contribute.
Co-workers A: You're right. I'm glad we can have these conversations and work towards being better together.
Co-workers B: Me too. Speaking of working together, do you remember when you gave me back my watch a few months ago? That meant a lot to me.

[MEMORY]
Co-worker B appreciates Co-worker A's competence and effort in their work, leading to a positive impact on the workplace. 
Co-worker A and Co-worker B work well together, resolving issues effectively, and enjoying moments of connection, making work more enjoyable.
